resources.string: Minimal signal strength of the default network that triggers reconnection
Interval between checking available networks, searching for the default one
Vibration notification when reconnects to default network

WiFi Prioritizer builds a layer of prioritizing your Wi-Fi networks on top of Android built-in Wi-Fi Manager.\nWiFi Prioritizer will keep an eye on available networks around your device and as soon as your default network is available and strong enough it’ll reconnect you to it. For this functionality to work you need to start background Service using menu option.

Default Wi-Fi network - Network of your choice. It’s probably your home network that you’d like to be connected most often.\nNotice that it has to one of the networks configured as remembered in your Android Wi-Fi Settings.

Minimal Wi-Fi Signal strength – minimal signal strength of the default network that triggers reconnection.\nChoosing Weak signal will reconnect device as soon as default network is available. Notice that if you reconnect too soon you can lose connection and Android default behavior will again connect you to the strongest remembered network available.\nChoosing Strong signal will reconnect device only when you’ll be close enough to your home router.

Wi-Fi check interval – how often WiFi Prioritizer will check available networks, searching for your default one.
Choosing short interval will make your default network available sooner but it’ll drain your battery faster.
Choosing too long interval will, on the contrary, make your battery live longer but probably won’t satisfy your requirements of this app.
Choosing 1 – 5 minutes is optimal for me.
Notification on reconnect – vibration notification when WiFi Prioritizer reconnects to your default network.
